title: 'An Englishman is a person who does things because they have been done before. An American is a person who does things because they haven't been done before' - Mark Twain. Is this true even today? - Quora
tags: Culture of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Dear friend, According to me, it is not necessary that if a person is american then only he will be able to do things that have never been done before. In today’s world extraordinary things happen. Even those people succeed about whom we cannot even think. And they do more than we expect from them. So, its better not to think people belonging to a certain nation do new successful things. Cause success never comes by seeing someone’s nationality, it comes to those who work hard for it.

response.answer_text: Why do I feel like Crowly is just passing on his homework to me? since you asked me to answer, here is my take on it World is increasingly globalized and nations are not uni-cultural anymore. So any attitudes that people perceive of any nations may not apply currently. In Mark Twain’s times America was a new country and they needed to be resourceful and inventive as compared to England. Today things are vastly different- demography has changed, people from US and uK are not predominantly white anymore, economics and the sphere of influence has changed. In conclusion- Generalizations dont apply.
